then.title: saucectl cypress runner configuration
then.description: Configuration file for cypress using saucectl

artifacts.description: Manage test output, such as logs, videos, and screenshots.

cleanup.description: Whether to remove all contents of artifacts directory

download.description: Settings related to downloading test artifacts from Sauce Labs.

match.description: Specifies which artifacts to download based on whether they match the file pattern provided. Supports the wildcard character '*'.

when.description: Specifies when and under what circumstances to download artifacts.

directory.description: Specifies the path to the folder in which to download artifacts. A separate subdirectory is generated in this location for each suite.

fileTransfer.description: Control how files are made available to the docker image.

image.description: Override which docker image to use (in case you have a custom image).

packages.description: Specifies any npm packages that are required to run tests.

dependencies.description: Specify local npm dependencies for saucectl to upload. These dependencies must already be installed in the local node_modules directory.

registry.description: Override the default and official NPM registry URL with a custom one.

strictSSL.description: Whether or not to do SSL key validation when making requests to the registry via https.

sauce.description: All settings related to how tests are run and identified in the Sauce Labs platform.

concurrency.description: Sets the maximum number of suites to execute at the same time. Excess suites are queued and run in order as each suite completes.

metadata.description: The set of properties that allows you to provide additional information about your project that helps you distinguish it in the various environments in which it is used and reviewed.

build.description: Sauce Labs can aggregate all jobs under one view based on their association with a build.

tags.description: Tag your jobs so you can find them easier in Sauce Labs.

region.description: Which Sauce Labs data center to target.

tunnel.description: SauceCTL supports using Sauce Connect to establish a secure connection when running your tests on Sauce Labs. To do so, launch a tunnel; then provide the identifier in this property.

owner.description: The owner (username) of the tunnel. Must be specified if the user that created the tunnel differs from the user that is running the tests.

retries.description: The number of times to retry a failing suite.

junit.description: The JUnit reporter merges test results from all jobs in the JUnit format into a single report.

filename.description: Filename for the generated JUnit report.

json.description: The JSON reporter merges test results from all jobs in the JSON format into a single report.

webhookURL.description: Webhook URL to pass JSON report.

filename.description: Filename for the generated JSON report.

showConsoleLog.description: Shows suites console.log locally. By default console.log is only shown on failures.

defaults.description: Settings that are applied onto every suite by default, if no value is set on a suite explicitly.

mode.description: Instructs saucectl run tests remotely through Sauce Labs (sauce) or locally on docker.

timeout.description: Instructs how long (in ms, s, m, or h) saucectl should wait for a suite to complete.

rootDir.description: The directory of files that need to be bundled and uploaded for the tests to run.

cypress.description: Contains details specific to the Cypress project.

configFile.description: The designated cypress configuration file. SauceCTL determines related files based on the location of the config file. By default saucectl defers to the test file location defined in cypress.json.

key.description: The secret key that grants permission to record your tests in the Cypress dashboard.

record.description: Whether to record your test results in the Cypress dashboard.

name.description: Name of the reporter. You may have to install the associated npm dependency through npm.packages field.

options.description: Options to pass to the reporter.

env.description: Set one or more environment variables. Values can be environment variables themselves. Not supported when running espresso/xcuitest!

suites.description: The set of properties providing details about the test suites to run.

name.description: The name of the test suite, which will be reflected in the test results in Sauce Labs.

browser.description: The name of the browser in which to run the tests.

browserVersion.description: Which version of the browser to use.

screenResolution.description: Specifies a browser window screen resolution, which may be useful if you are attempting to simulate a browser on a particular device type.

config.description: Provides details related to the Cypress test configuration.

testFiles.description: One or more paths to the Cypress test files to run for this suite, if not otherwise specified explicitly in cypress.json.

shard.description: When sharding is configured, saucectl automatically splits the tests (e.g. by spec or concurrency) so that they can easily run in parallel.

headless.description: Controls whether or not tests are run in headless mode (default: false)

preExec.description: Specifies which commands to execute before starting the tests.

timeZone.description: Specifies the timeZone for the suite.

then.description: Configuration file for cypress using saucectl

artifacts.description: Manage test output, such as logs, videos, and screenshots.

cleanup.description: Whether to remove all contents of artifacts directory

download.description: Settings related to downloading test artifacts from Sauce Labs.

match.description: Specifies which artifacts to download based on whether they match the file pattern provided. Supports the wildcard character '*'.

when.description: Specifies when and under what circumstances to download artifacts.

directory.description: Specifies the path to the folder in which to download artifacts. A separate subdirectory is generated in this location for each suite.

fileTransfer.description: Control how files are made available to the docker image.

image.description: Override which docker image to use (in case you have a custom image).

packages.description: Specifies any npm packages that are required to run tests.

dependencies.description: Specify local npm dependencies for saucectl to upload. These dependencies must already be installed in the local node_modules directory.

registry.description: Override the default and official NPM registry URL with a custom one.

strictSSL.description: Whether or not to do SSL key validation when making requests to the registry via https.

sauce.description: All settings related to how tests are run and identified in the Sauce Labs platform.

concurrency.description: Sets the maximum number of suites to execute at the same time. Excess suites are queued and run in order as each suite completes.

metadata.description: The set of properties that allows you to provide additional information about your project that helps you distinguish it in the various environments in which it is used and reviewed.

build.description: Sauce Labs can aggregate all jobs under one view based on their association with a build.

tags.description: Tag your jobs so you can find them easier in Sauce Labs.

region.description: Which Sauce Labs data center to target.

tunnel.description: SauceCTL supports using Sauce Connect to establish a secure connection when running your tests on Sauce Labs. To do so, launch a tunnel; then provide the identifier in this property.

owner.description: The owner (username) of the tunnel. Must be specified if the user that created the tunnel differs from the user that is running the tests.

retries.description: The number of times to retry a failing suite.

junit.description: The JUnit reporter merges test results from all jobs in the JUnit format into a single report.

filename.description: Filename for the generated JUnit report.

json.description: The JSON reporter merges test results from all jobs in the JSON format into a single report.

webhookURL.description: Webhook URL to pass JSON report.

filename.description: Filename for the generated JSON report.

showConsoleLog.description: Shows suites console.log locally. By default console.log is only shown on failures.

defaults.description: Settings that are applied onto every suite by default, if no value is set on a suite explicitly.

mode.description: Instructs saucectl run tests remotely through Sauce Labs (sauce) or locally on docker.

timeout.description: Instructs how long (in ms, s, m, or h) saucectl should wait for a suite to complete.

rootDir.description: The directory of files that need to be bundled and uploaded for the tests to run.

cypress.description: Contains details specific to the Cypress project.

key.description: The secret key that grants permission to record your tests in the Cypress dashboard.

record.description: Whether to record your test results in the Cypress dashboard.

name.description: Name of the reporter. You may have to install the associated npm dependency through npm.packages field.

options.description: Options to pass to the reporter.

env.description: Set one or more environment variables. Values can be environment variables themselves. Not supported when running espresso/xcuitest!

suites.description: The set of properties providing details about the test suites to run.

name.description: The name of the test suite, which will be reflected in the test results in Sauce Labs.

browser.description: The name of the browser in which to run the tests.

browserVersion.description: Which version of the browser to use.

platformName.description: A specific operating system on which to run the tests. Sauce Labs will try to choose a reasonable default if not explicitly specified.

screenResolution.description: Specifies a browser window screen resolution, which may be useful if you are attempting to simulate a browser on a particular device type.

config.description: Provides details related to the Cypress test configuration.

testingType.description: Specify the type of tests to execute; either e2e or component. Defaults to e2e

specPattern.description: One or more paths to the Cypress test files to run for this suite.

excludeSpecPattern.description: Exclude test files for this suite.

shard.description: When sharding is configured, saucectl automatically splits the tests (e.g. by spec or concurrency) so that they can easily run in parallel.

headless.description: Controls whether or not tests are run in headless mode (default: false)

preExec.description: Specifies which commands to execute before starting the tests.

timeZone.description: Specifies the timeZone for the suite.

then.title: saucectl espresso runner configuration
then.description: Configuration file for espresso using saucectl

defaults.description: Settings that are applied onto every suite by default, if no value is set on a suite explicitly.

espresso.description: Contains details specific to the Espresso project.

app.description: Local path or remote url to the application. If a remote url is defined, the app will be downloaded to a local temp directory before uploading to the SauceLabs Mobile App Storage service. Supports environment variables as values.

testApp.description: Local path or remote url to the test application. If a remote url is defined, the app will be downloaded to a local temp directory before uploading to the SauceLabs Mobile App Storage service. Supports environment variables as values.

otherApps.description: A list of applications to be installed alongside the main app. Applications can be defined as a local path or a remote url. If a remote url is defined, the app will be downloaded to a local temp directory before uploading to the SauceLabs Mobile App Storage service. Supports environment variables as values.

suites.description: The set of properties providing details about the test suites to run.

name.description: The name of the test suite, which will be reflected in the test results in Sauce Labs.

testApp.description: Local path or remote url to the test application. If a remote url is defined, the app will be downloaded to a local temp directory before uploading to the SauceLabs Mobile App Storage service. Supports environment variables as values.

testOptions.description: Allows you to control various details on how tests are executed.

notClass.description: Run all classes except those specified here.

package.description: Only run tests in the specified package.

notPackage.description: Run all tests except those in this package.

size.description: Run only tests that are annotated with the matching size value.

annotation.description: Only run tests with this annotation.

notAnnotation.description: Run all tests except those with this annotation.

numShards.description: When sharding is configured, saucectl automatically creates the sharded jobs for each of the devices defined for the suite based on the number of shards you specify. For example, for a suite testing a single emulator version that specifies 2 shards, saucectl clones the suite and runs one shard index on the first suite, and the other shard index on the identical clone suite.

clearPackageData.description: Removes all shared states from the testing device's CPU and memory at the completion of each test. Real devices only. Has to be used in conjunction with the 'useTestOrchestrator' flag.

useTestOrchestrator.description: Run each of your tests in its own Instrumentation instance to remove most of the app's shared state from the device CPU and memory between tests. Real devices only. Use this setting in conjunction with clearPackageData: true to completely remove all shared state.

emulators.description: Defines details for running this suite on virtual devices using an emulator.

name.description: The name of the emulator. To ensure name accuracy, check the list of supported virtual devices (https://app.saucelabs.com/live/web-testing/virtual).

platformVersions.description: The set of one or more versions of the device platform on which to run the test suite.

devices.description: Define details for running this suite on real devices.

id.description: Request a specific device for this test suite by its ID. You can look up device IDs in the Sauce Labs app or using our Devices API (https://docs.saucelabs.com/dev/api/rdc#get-devices).

name.description: Match the device name in full or partially (regex), which may provide a larger pool of available devices of the type you want.

platformVersion.description: The version of the Android operating system.

options.description: Further specify desired device attributes within the pool of devices that match the name and version criteria.

carrierConnectivity.description: Limit the device selection to those that are connected to a cellular network.

deviceType.description: Limit the device selection to a specific type of device.

private.description: Limit the device selection to only match from your organization's private pool.

audioCapture.description: Overwrite app settings for real device to capture audio.

instrumentation.description: Overwrite app settings for real device instrumentation.

networkCapture.description: Overwrite app settings for real device to capture network.

then.title: saucectl playwright runner configuration
then.description: Configuration file for playwright using saucectl

defaults.description: Settings that are applied onto every suite by default, if no value is set on a suite explicitly.

playwright.description: Contains details specific to the Playwright project.

configFile.description: The path to playwright config file

suites.description: The set of properties providing details about the test suites to run.

name.description: The name of the test suite, which will be reflected in the test results in Sauce Labs.

testMatch.description: Paths to the playwright test files. Regex values are supported to indicate all files of a certain type or in a certain directory, etc.

excludedTestFiles.description: Exclude test files to skip the tests.

params.description: Details any additional parameters you wish to set for the test suite.

globalTimeout.description: Total timeout in milliseconds for the whole test run.

timeout.description: Changes the timeout for the test (milliseconds).

grep.description: Patterns to run tests based on their title.

grepInvert.description: Patterns to skip tests based on their title.

repeatEach.description: The number of times to repeat each test.

retries.description: The maximum number of retry attempts given to failed tests.

maxFailures.description: The maximum number of test failures for this test run. After reaching this number, testing will stop and exit with an error. Setting to zero (default) disables this behavior.

updateSnapshots.description: Whether to update expected snapshots with the actual results produced by the test run

numShards.description: When sharding is configured, saucectl automatically creates the sharded jobs based on the number of shards you specify. For example, for a suite that specifies 2 shards, saucectl clones the suite and runs shard 1/2 on the first suite, and the other shard 2/2 on the identical clone suite.

shard.description: When sharding is configured, saucectl automatically splits the tests (e.g. by spec or concurrency) so that they can easily run in parallel.

then.title: saucectl puppeteer runner configuration
then.description: Configuration file for puppeteer using saucectl

defaults.description: Settings that are applied onto every suite by default, if no value is set on a suite explicitly.

puppeteer.description: Contains details specific to the Puppeteer project.

suites.description: The set of properties providing details about the test suites to run.

name.description: The name of the test suite, which will be reflected in the test results in Sauce Labs.

testMatch.description: The glob patterns Jest uses to detect test files.

then.title: saucectl puppeteer-replay runner configuration
then.description: Configuration file for puppeteer-replay using saucectl

defaults.description: Settings that are applied onto every suite by default, if no value is set on a suite explicitly.

suites.description: The set of properties providing details about the test suites to run.

name.description: The name of the test suite, which will be reflected in the test results in Sauce Labs.

recordings.description: Relative paths to the chrome devtools recordings.

platform.description: A specific operating system on which to run the tests. Sauce Labs will try to choose a reasonable default if not explicitly specified.

then.title: saucectl testcafe runner configuration
then.description: Configuration file for testcafe using saucectl

defaults.description: Settings that are applied onto every suite by default, if no value is set on a suite explicitly.

testcafe.description: Contains details specific to the TestCafe project.

suites.description: The set of properties providing details about the test suites to run.

name.description: The name of the test suite, which will be reflected in the test results in Sauce Labs.

headless.description: Controls whether or not tests are run in headless mode (default: false)

assertionTimeout.description: Specifies the time (in milliseconds) TestCafe attempts to successfully execute an assertion if a selector property or a client function was passed as an actual value.

clientScripts.description: Injects scripts into pages visited during the tests.

shard.description: When sharding is configured, saucectl automatically splits the tests (e.g. by spec or concurrency) so that they can easily run in parallel.

compilerOptions.description: Specifies the typescript compiler options to be used when running the tests.

configPath.description: Specifies the path to the TypeScript tsconfig.json file.

customCompilerModulePath.description: Specifies the path to a custom TypeScript compiler module.

options.description: Specifies TypeScript compiler options. Full reference: https://www.typescriptlang.org/tsconfig#compilerOptions

disablePageCaching.description: Prevents the browser from caching page content.

filter.description: Allows you to specify which tests or fixtures to run.

test.description: Runs a test with the specified name.

testGrep.description: Runs tests whose names match the specified grep pattern.

testMeta.description: Runs tests whose metadata matches the specified key-value pair.

fixture.description: Runs a test with the specified fixture name.

fixtureGrep.description: Runs tests whose fixture names match the specified grep pattern.

fixtureMeta.description: Runs tests whose fixtures metadata matches the specified key-value pair.

pageLoadTimeout.description:
Specifies the time (in milliseconds) passed after the DOMContentLoaded event, within which TestCafe waits for the window.load event to fire.

After the timeout passes or the window.load event is raised (whichever happens first), TestCafe starts the test.

quarantineMode.description: Enable quarantine mode to eliminate false negatives and detect unstable tests. TestCafe quarantines tests that fail, and repeats them until they yield conclusive results.

successThreshold.description: The number of successful attempts necessary to confirm a tests success. The option value should be greater than 0.

attemptLimit.description: The maximum number of test execution attempts. The option value must be larger than the value of the successThreshold.

screenshots.description: Allows you to specify the screenshot options.

takeOnFails.description: Specifies that a screenshot should be taken whenever a test fails.

fullPage.description: Specifies that the full page should be captured, including content that is not visible due to overflow.

selectorTimeout.description: Specifies the time (in milliseconds) within which selectors attempt to return a node.

simulators.description: Run tests against the simulators defined here.

platformVersions.description: Which platform versions (OS versions) should be used. Multiple values are treated as 'AND', thus tests run across multiple versions.

skipJsErrors.description: Determines whether to ignore JavaScript errors on a webpage.

skipUncaughtErrors.description: Ignores uncaught errors and unhandled promise rejections in test code.

speed.description: Specifies the test execution speed. Provide a number between 1 (the fastest) and 0.01 (the slowest).

src.description: Specifies files or directories from which to run tests.

stopOnFirstFail.description: Stops a test run if a test fails.

then.title: saucectl xcuitest runner configuration
then.description: Configuration file for xcuitest using saucectl

defaults.description: Settings that are applied onto every suite by default, if no value is set on a suite explicitly.

xcuitest.description: Contains details specific to the XCUITest project.

app.description: Local path or remote url to the application. If a remote url is defined, the app will be downloaded to a local temp directory before uploading to the SauceLabs Mobile App Storage service. Supports environment variables as values.

testApp.description: Local path or remote url to the test application. If a remote url is defined, the app will be downloaded to a local temp directory before uploading to the SauceLabs Mobile App Storage service. Supports environment variables as values.

otherApps.description: A list of applications to be installed alongside the main app. Applications can be defined as a local path or a remote url. If a remote url is defined, the app will be downloaded to a local temp directory before uploading to the SauceLabs Mobile App Storage service. Supports environment variables as values.

suites.description: The set of properties providing details about the test suites to run.

name.description: The name of the test suite, which will be reflected in the test results in Sauce Labs.

testApp.description: Local path or remote url to the test application. If a remote url is defined, the app will be downloaded to a local temp directory before uploading to the SauceLabs Mobile App Storage service. Supports environment variables as values.

testOptions.description: Allows you to control various details on how tests are executed.

notClass.description: Run all classes except those specified here.

devices.description: Define details for running this suite on real devices.

id.description: Request a specific device for this test suite by its ID. You can look up device IDs in the Sauce Labs app or using our Devices API (https://docs.saucelabs.com/dev/api/rdc#get-devices).

name.description: Match the device name in full or partially (regex), which may provide a larger pool of available devices of the type you want.

platformVersion.description: The version of the iOS operating system.

options.description: Further specify desired device attributes within the pool of devices that match the name and version criteria.

carrierConnectivity.description: Limit the device selection to those that are connected to a cellular network.

deviceType.description: Limit the device selection to a specific type of device.

private.description: Limit the device selection to only match from your organization's private pool.
